title: Jodie Comer dazzles in metallic top with edgy black jacket as she promotes Free Guy
text:
She stars in a movie about a bank teller who realizes he is just a non-playable video game character.

And Jodie Comer, 26, stole the show in a dazzling metallic top as she promoted Free Guy alongside co-star Ryan Reynolds at New York Comic-Con on Thursday.

Attendees were treated to a first look at the upcoming action film at the convention, along with insight from the cast.

Dazzling! Jodie Comer promoted her upcoming film Free Guy at New York Comic-Con on Thursday with co-star Ryan Reynolds

Man of style! Ryan Reynolds was looking like a million bucks as he talked about the new film

Jodie looked fabulous in a silver button down blouse, black jacket, matching trousers, and combat boots.

The Killing Eve actress wore her blonde locks down in loose, romantic curls.

She looked absolutely thrilled to be chatting about the film alongside her co-star Ryan and director Shawn Levy.

In the film, Ryan plays bank teller Guy, who discovers he is just a non-playable character in an open world video game.

Let's talk! Reynolds raved about his passion for the film alongside director Shawn Levy and co-star Jodie Comer

Virtual reality: Reynolds plays a bank teller who realizes he is just a character in a video game in Free Guy

Cast of characters: Free Guy also stars Joe Keery, Utkarsh Ambudkar, and Lil Rel Howery

As developers attempt to control Guy after learning about his realization, Guy is also on a mission to save the game, which is on the verge of going offline.

It's the first time in a while Ryan has been truly passionate about a project.

'I haven't been this fully immersed and engaged in something since Deadpool,' Ryan explained at the convention, according to EW.com.

Passionate: 'I haven't been this fully immersed and engaged in something since Deadpool,' Ryan explained

'I think we live in really weird times right now, you're watching the news and the top story today is "it's the end of the world." I felt a kinship to the character in that you can sometimes feel like a background character. The world is on loop and you have no control over what's happening.'

Jodie plays two versions of the same character, a woman in the real-world named Milly, and her online avatar, Molotov Girl.

'The biggest thing for me was the physicality of her,' she said of the challenges of playing her character, according to CNET. 'They move differently. There's also an accent filter in the game, so they speak quite differently, which you'll hear. We create avatars of how we might want to behave."

Let's do this: Reynolds plays a video game character who realizes his world is on the verge of going offline

Stranger Things star Joe Keery, who also appears in the film, raved about Levy's directing approach.

'Shawn, I feel like all his projects have a sense of heart and a real sense of character,' he said.

'He instilled the same thing in this movie, it has the background of the video game but at the end of the day it's really a character piece and for all of us as actors, that’s the best thing to work on. That's all you can ask for out of a piece.'

Free Guy also stars Channing Tatum, Lil Rel Howery, Utkarsh Ambudkar, and will premiere July 3, 2020.
description: Attendees were treated to a first look at the upcoming action film at the convention, along with insight from the cast. Ryan looked thrilled to be chatting about the new film at the NY convention.
